name: The Game Boy, a hardware autopsy.
#gbdev on EFnet
description: IRC channel.

name: gbdev.gg8.se
description: This is basically the home of the gbdev scene. The wiki has a lot of articles from previous sites, tutorials and other documents about a lot of topics.

name: devrs.com/gb
description: Jeff Frohwein’s page, this the main reference for everything. Almost everything is archived here: code examples and working programs(ASM and C), complete documentation and various tools.

name: Game Boy Programming Manual
description: Official Game Boy programming & hardware manual by Nintendo. Pretty much everything in the console is covered and explained in this manual. This should be your first and main resource to start understanding what game boy is.

name: The Cycle-Accurate Game Boy Docs
description: A precise documentation by AntonioND to make a cicle-accurate Game Boy emulator.

name: Pan Docs
description: The single most comprehensive technical reference to Game Boy that is available to the public.

name: Everything You Always Wanted To Know About GAME BOY
description: but were afraid to ask

name: GBSOUND.txt
description: A document detailing the Game Boy sound engine.

name: DMG Schematics
description: Hardware schematics.

name: GB Instructions Game Boy Assembly commands.

description: Some tips for coding in Assembly by Jeff Frohwein.

name: ASMotor Manual
description: A reference for rgbds.

name: wla-dx documentation
description: WLA DX Macro Assembler Package manual.

name: gbdev FAQs
description: Must read by Jeff Frohwein.

name: Game Boy CPU InstructionSet Sheet (GCISheet)
description: Cheatsheet for the available Instruction Set.

name: Opcode table with timings and flags
Game Boy CPU Manual
description: Assembly language commands, timings and opcodes.

name: Assembly Language Programming Course
description: Machine and assembly language programming concepts that illustrate basic principles and techniques. Application through study of the Z80 chip and Game Boy programming assignments (Center for Research in Arts, Technology, Education, and Learning CRATEL at Withicha State University).

name: Game Boy Bootrom
description: Commented dump of the DMG bootrom.

name: GB Technical Information
description: Some old code resources.

name: Differences between the Z80 and the gameboy's processor
fruttenboel
description: Page with loads of information on the actual hardware, custom boards to interface with the console and other related projects.

name: Game Boy Camera RE
description: Documentation about GB Camera and tools used to reverse engineer it by using Arduino UNO.

name: Creating photorealistic images with neural networks and a Gameboy Camera
The Game Boy Printer
description: An in-depth technical document about the printer hardware, the communication protocol and the usual routine that games used for implementing the print feature.

name: Ben Heck Reverse Engineers Game Boy Printer
AntonioND's docs
description: Corrected schematics and infos on cartridge header data

name: Gekkio's Game Boy cartridge types
description: An overview on existing cartridge types.

name: Gekkio's cartridge analysis
description: DMG-BEAN-02, MBC1, no MBC

name: Game Boy Cartridges Schematics
description: Schematics for MBC2 and MBC3 types.

name: Reiner Ziegler's Game Boy page
description: Commercial and homemades programmable cartridges and programming systems. Tutorials, wiring and schematics provided.

description: First schematics by Jeff Frohwein.

name: MBC1 and MBC2 cartridges circuits and explaination on how these MBC actually bank switch and control RAM.
GB Rom List
description: Navigable table of every GB game released with details on their cartridges.

description: Emulating the functionality of a GameBoy cartridge with the development board STM32F4.

name: Wolf
description: Gameboy cartridge with co-processor.

name: Building a Game Boy emulator in JavaScript
description: Step by step tutorial.

name: Writing a Game Boy emulator, Cinoop
RealBoy Emulator
description: A series of posts about the design and implementation of the RealBoy Emulator

name: Codeslinger
description: Another series of posts documenting the building of an emulator.

name: Mooneye-gb
description: A Game Boy research project and emulator written in Rust.

name: php-terminal-Game Boy-emulator
description: A PHP Terminal Game Boy Emulator.

name: gameboy-Online
description: A Game Boy Color emulator that utilizes HTML5 canvas and JavaScript audio APIs to provide a full emulation of the console.

name: cboy
description: A Game Boy emulator written in C. Runs on Mac OS X and Linux.

name: weplay
description: Collaborative Game Boy emulation powered by JavaScript.

name: giibiiadvance
description: A GB, GBC emulator with GB Camera support. Written in C.

name: GBE+
description: A DMG/GBC emulator focused on enhancements. Built in C++ and SDL.

name: Sameboy
description: A DMG/GBC emulator written in portable C.

name: GameYob
description: DMG/GBC emulator for Nintendo (3)DS.

name: oneup-gb
description: C++ DMG emulator. Currently provides SDL frontend and Retroarch integration.

name: rustboy
description: A basic DMG emulator written in Rust, using the Piston engine for window creation and graphics.

name: Gearboy
description: C++ emulator that runs on iOS, Raspberry Pi, Mac, Windows and Linux.

name: GameLad
description: C++/SDL almost fully featured emulator.

name: Wadatsumi
description: Emulator written in Arrow.

name: Binjgb
description: 5kloc emulator in C that passes most of the tests.

name: jgilchrist
description: A Gameboy emulator in modern C++.

name: rgbds
description: Assembler and linker package (a fork currently updated).

name: wla-dx
description: Yet Another GB-Z80/Z80/.. Multi Platform Cross Assembler Package.

name: gbasm
description: A JavaScript based compiler for Gameboy z80 assembly code.

name: tniASM
description: Macro Assembler.

name: Assembler
description: Assembler written in Swift.

name: The Game Boy Developer's Kit (GBDK)
description: A set of tools that enable to develop programs for the Nintendo Game Boy system in C. Includes a set of libraries for the most common requirements and generates image files for use with a real Game Boy.

name: BGB
description: Powerful Game Boy emulator and debugger. Provides an accurate hardware emulation.

name: Gambatte
description: Open-source, cross-platform and accurate emulator for Game Boy and Game Boy Color.

name: ZGB
description: A little engine for creating games for the original Game Boy.

name: Game Boy Tile Data Generator
description: HTML5 / JS web application that will convert bitmap images to hexidecimal data appropriate for use in tile based graphical applications, specifically GB.

name: rgbds_textmate
description: Some syntax highlighting rules for coding in Z80 assembly as a Textmate language plugin. Works in Sublime Text 2 and 3. The syntax is particularly designed for rgbds and Game Boy-specific Z80 instructions.

name: Harry Mulder's GB Development
description: Some sources and home of Game Boy Tile Designer and Game Boy Map Builder tools.

name: GBT PLAYER
description: A music player library and converter kit for Game Boy that can be used with RGBDS.

name: ROM Header Utility
description: An online tool to inspect and modify a ROM's header data, including the logo.

name: gbcamextract
description: Extracts photos from Game Boy Camera saves.

name: ASMSchool
description: A set of lessons by Duo about coding in Assembly for GB/GBC and disassembling.

name: dev'rs ASM section
description: A lot of working demos and sources.

name: Assembly tutorial by David Pello
description: Good document to actually learn to produce working asm code for gb. Brief explainations of many important topics. Many examples with commented source code (spanish only).

name: Assembly tutorial by David Pello
description: The english version of the resource above.

name: Beginner's Guide to Reverse Engineering GB
description: Some starting tips on disassembling and reverse engineering.

name: gb-template
description: A template with basic functions pre-made such as joypad input, DMA transfers, and map/tile data loading.

name: assemblydigest
description: Exploring Game Boy programming techniques.

name: Reverse Engineering for Beginners
description: Free ebook (1060 pages) by Dennis Yurichev.

name: FlappyBoy: Making a simple Game Boy Game
Game Boy DMA transfer routines
description: Understanding and using DMA routines.

name: 8-Bit Wonderland
description: Well-written introductory document about how the Game Boy works and how to start developing working code for it.

name: Grooves Game Boy Programming
description: A complete set of lessons about implementing various game mechanics in a Game Boy game.

name: How to Write a Simple Side Scrolling Game
description: Old (but still relevant) tutorial.

name: GBDK Tutorial
description: Fairly minimal game demo for getting started with GBDK.

name: GBDK Sprite
description: Presents a workflow for getting multiple sprites to display and animate.

name: GBDK Color
description: Extends your knowledge of basic spriting on the Game Boy by adding colors to sprites, backgrounds and the window layer.

name: GBDK Joypad
description: Details the use of the joypad with GBDK.

name: Game Boy home of Flavor
description: Some full games and sources.

name: RedPlusPlus
description: An upgrade to Pokémon Red. Fixes several bugs and adds a lot of new features.

name: GB303
description: GB303 wavetable-based TB-303 style synthesizer for the Nintendo Gameboy.

name: fpgaboy
description: Implementation Nintendo's Game Boy console on an FPGA.

name: Piglet
description: A LUA-driven AI that plays classic Game Boy color games using experimentation. In active development.

name: The Game Boy Project
description: Provides a study on the hardware and detailed constructional information for the realisation of three 8-bit bidirectional parallel ports.

name: gbdk-n
description: Aims to update the gbdk libraries to be compatible with new versions of SDCC and provide helpers for building roms.

name: Wiz
description: A high-level assembly language for writing homebrew on retro console platforms (Game Boy, NES, Atari 2600, and more).

name: Gatesboy
description: Non-gaming purposes applications development.

name: Game Boy Demospotting
description: A collection of demos.

name: Nintendo's fake logos
description: Every cartridge has to show the authentic logo to be considered valid and be runned, but obviously some companies managed to exploit the check system.

name: Booting the Game Boy with a custom logo
description: Bypassing the Nintendo logo check.

name: GBDK Developers
description: Active blog about everything related to the scene. Including features, insights and interviews.

name: Ostrich
description: A Game Boy Sound System player written in Swift.

name: mGB
description: A Gameboy cartridge program that enables the Gameboy to act as a full MIDI supported sound module.

name: GBVisualizer
description: Demonstrating the use of two undocumented Gameboy Color registers, nicknamed PCM12 (FF76) and PCM34 (FF77), which can be used to read the current PCM amplitude of the 4 APU channels.

name: GBVideoPlayer
description: A technical demo demonstrating how the Gameboy LCD controller can be hacked to make a Gameboy Color play a full motion video in color, together with music.

name: rgbgfx
description: A program which converts PNG images into the Game Boy's planar tile format, for eventual integration into RGBDS.

name: ArduinoGameBoy
description: Arduino based Game Boy cartridge reader and writer.
